verb.description: Assign a job or role to (someone)
examples: she has been appointed to the board
they appointed her as personnel manager
a delegated engineer will be appointed to oversee each graduate

verb.description: Determine or decide on (a time or a place)
examples: they appointed a day in May for the meeting

verb.description: Decide the disposal of (property of which one is not the owner) under powers granted by the owner.
examples: trustees appoint the capital to the beneficiaries

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French apointer, from a point to a point.
